entry.title: EU civilian mission technical team arrives at Armenia-Azerbaijan border

media:group.media:title: EU civilian mission technical team arrives at Armenia-Azerbaijan border
media:group.media:description:
A technical team from the EU‚Äôs civilian mission to the Armenia-Azerbaijan border visited the villages of Tretuk and Kutakan in the eastern part of Armenia‚Äôs Gegharkunik region, according to the region‚Äôs governor.
Karabakh President Arayik Harutyunyan convened a special meeting of the region‚Äôs parliament after holding talks in Yerevan over the weekend with Pashinyan to discuss ongoing negotiation efforts with Azerbaijan. Azerbaijani names of communities and places in Armenia‚Äôs southern Syunik region have been removed from Google Maps and Google Earth, according to Arman Tatoyan, Armenia‚Äôs former Human Rights Defender.

entry.title: Bringing Estonian space expertise to Armenia

media:group.media:title: Bringing Estonian space expertise to Armenia
media:group.media:description:
Martin Simon is the CEO and founder of Falconers, an Estonia-based space and Earth observation company. Mr. Simon sat down with CivilNet‚Äôs Mark Dovich to discuss the launch of Armenia‚Äôs first space satellite earlier this year, the potential for collaboration between Armenia and Estonia, and his impressions of Armenia‚Äôs booming IT sector.
0:00 Bringing Estonian space companies to Armenia 1:47 Estonian expertise for Armenian satellites 3:22 Developing space industries in small countries 6:09 Taking advantage of Armenia‚Äôs booming IT sector

entry.title: Armenian defense minister heads to India for talks

media:group.media:title: Armenian defense minister heads to India for talks
media:group.media:description:
Armenian Defense Minister Suren Papikyan held talks with Indian counterpart, Rajnath Singh.
A U.S. congressional delegation arrived in Yerevan for meetings with Armenian Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan and other senior officials.
The issue of deploying both OSCE and CSTO observers to the Armenia-Azerbaijan border is under discussion, according to Armenian Foreign Minister Ararat Mirzoyan.
Armenia‚Äôs internet freedom has improved this year, according to Freedom House.

entry.title: ‚ÄúAn independent Armenia guarantees the survival of our national privilege,‚Äù Serj Tankian

media:group.media:title: ‚ÄúAn independent Armenia guarantees the survival of our national privilege,‚Äù Serj Tankian
media:group.media:description:
Armenian-American singer and activist Serj Tankian sat down with Lara Tcholakian to talk about what it means to lead a meaningful and mindful life. He takes us on a journey of how his sense of justice and passion for music and the arts enabled him to discover his purpose. Tankian speaks about his experiences during and after the 2020 Artsakh War, his thoughts about the need for a strong and independent Armenia, his triggers related to injustice, and the importance of finding the voice within.
About Serj Tankian
Serj Tankian is a renowned singer, songwriter, poet, visual artist, film producer, composer, and activist. He is the founder and lead vocalist of the Grammy-winning band System of a Down. Since the band‚Äôs hiatus, Tankian has released a number of solo albums, including Elect the Dead (and Elect the Dead Symphony), Imperfect Harmonies, and Harakiri. He has composed soundtracks and scores for symphonic orchestras and films, including 1915, Furious, and Spitak. He is founder of the record label Serjical Strike Records and has served as a producer for numerous documentaries and movies, most recently Amerikatsi. He is the co-founder of the non-profit organization Axis of Justice, alongside fellow musician Tom Morello, and is an ardent advocate for environmental justice and animal protection, among many other social and political issues.
Program overview
In a new open setting, Lara deconstructs inherited cultural and historical narratives, memories, life lessons and experiences from change catalysts. Her guests reflect on the stories, people, events and mindsets that have shaped their professional and personal lives, enabling them to create a more mindful life.

entry.title: The diaspora must ask itself: What do we want to do for Armenia?

media:group.media:title: The diaspora must ask itself: What do we want to do for Armenia?
media:group.media:description:
Alexandre Meterissian, the Managing Director of Teneo, joined Levon Affeyan, the Founder and CEO of Seatply Products, to talk about the strengths of Armenia‚Äôs economy. Meterissian also discussed his Armenian immigrant background, the changing relationship between Armenia and the diaspora, and how diasporans should approach helping Armenia.
